Analysis.name: Case fatality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
The random sequence was computer generated ("PROC plan software"), with allocation concealed. There were no apparent imbalances between groups.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns
Open-label study design. No information available regarding deviations that arose because of the trial context. Analyses conducted on an intention-to-treat basis
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Outcome data were available for all participants.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Outcome measured appropriately (case fatality at 3 months). Ascertainment consistent between groups with blinded assessors
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Analysis conducted in line with prespecified plan. No evidence of multiple eligible measurements or multiple analyses
Overall.bias.support: There are some concerns arising from potential bias due to deviations from intended interventions.

Analysis.name: Case fatality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
Manuscript states trial was conducted in a randomised, double-blind fashion. There were no apparent imbalances between groups.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk
Participants and caregivers blinded to allocation. Analysis conducted on an intention-to-treat basis
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Outcome data were available for all participants.

Analysis.name: Case fatality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
Participants were randomised using "sealed envelopes", with allocation concealed. There were no apparent imbalances between groups.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns

Participants and caregivers probably aware of intervention (no sham/placebo thrombolysis was performed). No information provided regarding deviations arising because of the trial context. Outcome data are missing for one participant, with no reason provided for exclusion, precluding intention-to-treat analysis. However, there is no substantial impact on the estimated effect of the intervention irrespective of the missing participant's outcome status.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Missing data for one participant (total cohort 110); reason for exclusion unclear. However, there is no substantial impact on the estimated effect of the intervention irrespective of the missing participant's outcome status.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Outcome measured appropriately (case fatality at 6 months). Ascertainment consistent between groups with blinded assessors
Overall.bias.support: Some concerns arising from potential bias due to deviations from intended interventions and the lack of a prespecified analysis plan

Analysis.name: Case fatality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Some concerns
No detail regarding the randomisation process or allocation concealment provided. Minimal baseline information available in conference abstract
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: High risk

No information provided regarding blinding. No information provided regarding deviations arising because of the trial context. While 104 participants are reported to have been randomised, outcome data are only provided for 101. Given the size of the intervention groups included in this review, this represents a significant proportion of participants.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Outcome data are missing for 3 participants, with no explanation provided. However, unlikely 'missingness' dependent on the true value.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Appropriate outcome measure (case fatality at 3 months post-surgery). However, it is unlikely that ascertainment of this outcome would vary between groups.
Overall.bias.support: Significant concerns arising from multiple domains

Analysis.name: Case fatality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk
Allocation sequence was generated by computer, and sealed envelopes were used. There were no apparent imbalances between groups.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Some concerns

Correspondence with authors revealed that treating clinicians were blinded, while participants were not blinded. No information provided regarding deviations arising because of the trial context. Analyses conducted on an intention-to-treat basis
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: Outcome data were available for all participants.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Outcome measured appropriately (case fatality at 30 days). Correspondence revealed that outcome assessment was performed by blinded assessors.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Analysis conducted in line with prespecified plan. No evidence of multiple eligible measurements or multiple analyses
Overall.bias.support: Some concerns arising from potential bias due to deviations from intended interventions

Analysis.name: Case fatality
Bias.arising.from.the.randomization.proc: Low risk

Correspondence with study authors revealed that the allocation sequence was generated randomly and that allocation concealment was performed. While the sample size is small, it is unlikely that baseline differences arose due to problems with the allocation process.
Bias.due.to.deviations.from.intended.int: Low risk

Caregivers unaware of intervention; all participants were comatose. Correspondence with study authors revealed that no deviations arose because of the trial context. Unpublished data provided by study authors permited analysis on an intention-to-treat basis.
Bias.due.to.missing.outcome.data.support: 6-month follow-up data are missing for one participant in each group. However, there is no apparent pattern to the missing data; accordingly, it is likely that other factors were responsible for the participants being lost to follow-up, rather than the outcome value. One further participant for whom outcome data are not available was randomised but died before first medication administration.
Bias.in.measurement.of.the.outcome.suppo: Outcome measured appropriately (in-hospital case fatality). Correspondence with study authors revealed that outcomes were determined by a blinded assessor.
Bias.in.selection.of.the.reported.result: Analysis conducted in line with prespecified plan. No evidence of multiple eligible measurements or multiple analyses
Overall.bias.support: There were some concerns arising from missing outcome data.
